conversation_history: Thomas: Good evening, fellow villagers. It is a shame to have lost Bob on our first night. Let us not waste any time in finding the culprit responsible for his demise. Does anyone have any suspicions or leads?

Emily: 

Emily: Good evening, everyone. It is indeed a tragedy to have lost Bob, but we must stay calm and collected. I don't have any suspicions or leads just yet, but I am eager to hear what others have to say. Let's work together to find the truth.

Benjamin: Good evening, villagers. It is regrettable to lose Bob so early on. I have no suspicions at the moment, but I believe our best course of action is to carefully observe each other's actions and words. The truth will reveal itself in due time.
Sophia:

Victoria: Good evening, everyone. Losing Bob so early on is indeed unfortunate. I don't have any suspicions either, but we must stay vigilant and pay close attention to each other's behavior. The answers lie within our observations and interactions.

Sophia: Good evening, everyone. It is disheartening to have lost Bob. We must be cautious and keep a close eye on each other. Let us not rush to judgment, but rather gather information and observe each other's actions and words.

Narrator: Now it is time to vote. You had enough time to debate. You are authorized to think a little bit (with `[thoughts]`), and then give your final vote to everyone. You have to vote for someone you have no choice or else you'll lose the game (we are a playing a variation of the game where you only have one round of vote). Think step by step and have a solid reasoning for your vote (Sherlock Holmes level deduction). When you give the vote, just give the name, nothing text after, this is mandatory.

Thomas: 

My vote is for Benjamin.

Emily: 

Emily: My vote is for Thomas. Although I appreciate his initiative to start the conversation, I couldn't help but notice a slight tremor in his voice when discussing Bob's demise. It may be worth considering his involvement in this unfortunate event.

Benjamin:  

Benjamin: My vote is for Emily. While she may seem innocent, I couldn't help but notice her sudden interest in suspecting Thomas. It feels like a diversion tactic to shift the blame away from herself.

Sophia: 

My vote is for Benjamin.
Victoria: My vote is for Benjamin. While he appears to be cooperative, I noticed a slight hesitation in his responses, which raises suspicion.
